alert.note: Alert for Chouteau (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 1:15AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western and central Chouteau County. * WHEN...Until 415 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 113 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Benton, Highwood, Carter and Loma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
